body.name: Fractal Design Define 7 XL Black Brushed Aluminum/Steel E-ATX Silent Modular Tempered Glass Window Full Tower Computer Case
body.description: The Define 7 XL sets a new standard for what you should expect from a full tower case in terms of modularity, flexibility and ease of use. • New chassis design opens up to fully expose the case interior • Anodized aluminum front panel with reversible dual-handed hinges • Mount up to 18 HDD/SSDs plus five SSDs in the Storage Layout Plenty of room for massive builds Use the Open Layout for more headroom and gargantuan water-cooling with radiators up to 480 mm in front or top and 280 mm in the base Spacious, extensively adaptable dual-layout interior easily accommodates large motherboards up to E-ATX and SSI-EEB Two 5.25” ODD bays can be converted to an additional front fan mount with filtered louver covering Ventilated PSU shroud with two-part removable cover Ultra-slim Nexus+ 2 fan hub connects up to three PWM fans and six 3-pin fans Superlative storage possibilities Mount up to 18 HDD/SSDs plus five SSDs in the Storage Layout (6 HDD/SSD trays + 2 SSD brackets + 2 Multibrackets included) Detachable PSU cable shield and integrated cable guides with Velcro straps further simplify cable management behind the board Sturdy new HDD cage design with vibration damped trays 13 pass-through holes with ten rubber grommets and two removable covers make for clean cable routing regardless of motherboard size Airflow and cooling Outstanding cooling capacity with a total of 9 x 140 mm or 11 x 120 mm fan mounts and three preinstalled Dynamic X2 GP-14 fans Easy-to-clean high airflow nylon filters with full PSU coverage and convenient front access The two 5.25" ODD bays can be converted to an additional front fan mount with filtered louver covering Exceptionally silent Silence-optimized construction with industrial sound-damped front, top, and side panels USB Type-C USB 3.1 Gen 2 Type-C with fast charging support and speeds up to 10Gbps SSI-EEB Easily holds your SSI-EEB motherboard Moduvent Top panel effortlessly swaps from sound damped solid steel to filtered ventilation Versatile new Multibracket The included Multibrackets lets you convert any unused fan position to an HDD, SSD or pump mount. Universal Multibracket Specifications 3.5"/2.5" Universal drive brackets 6 + 2 included, 18 positions total Dedicated 2.5" drive brackets 2 included, 5 positions total 5.25” drive mounts 2 Expansion slots 9 + 3 Front ports 1 x USB 3.1 Gen 2 Type-C, 2 x USB 3.0, 2 x USB 2.0, Audio I/O, Power button, Reset button Total fan mounts 11 x 120 mm or 9 x 140 mm Front fan 4 x 120 mm or 3 x 140 mm, (2 x Dynamic X2 GP-14 included) Top fan 4 x 120 mm or 3 x 140 mm Rear fan 1 x 120/140 mm, (1 x Dynamic X2 GP-14 included) Bottom fan 2 x 120/140 mm Dust filters Top, 2 x Front, Bottom + PSU Fixed velcro straps Yes Cable routing grommets Yes Captive thumbscrews HDD brackets, SSD brackets, PSU bracket Left side panel Tempered glass Right side panel Industrial sound-damped steel Compatibility Motherboard compatibility E-ATX / ATX / mATX / mITX / EE-ATX / SSI-CEB / SSI-EEB Power supply type ATX PSU max length 250 mm (both HDD cages installed) GPU max length Storage layout: 359 mm - Open layout: 549 mm (524 mm w/ front fan) CPU cooler max height 185 mm Front radiator Up to 480/420 mm Top radiator Up to 480/420 mm Rear radiator 120 mm Bottom radiator Up to 240/280 mm Cable routing space 30 mm Vertical GPU Support (with Flex VRC-25) 65mm total clearance, standard 2-slot GPU (<38mm thickness) recommended for optimum cooling Dimensions Case dimensions (LxWxH) 604 x 240 x 566 mm Case dimensions w/o feet/protrusions/screws 590 x 240 x 548 mm Package dimensions (LxWxH) 646 x 357 x 708 mm Net weight 16.64 kg Package weight 18.84 kg Volume 77.6 liters Other Warranty 2 Years Package contents Define 7 XL - Accessory box - User manual - Ventilated top panel - ODD bracket - ODD bay cover - 2 x HDD/SSD trays EAN 7340172702061 UPC 843276102067 JAN 4537694275385 Product code FD-C-DEF7X-03

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: About Fractal Design Fractal Design is a PC gaming hardware manufacturer based in Gothenburg, Sweden. Since its inception in 2007, Fractal has developed gaming products which fuse Scandinavian design, user-centric innovation and premium quality. Today, Fractal offers gaming hardware to customers around the globe from its offices in Sweden, Taiwan, China and the US. Fractal Design Define 7 XL Tempered Glass Re-defining capacity The Define 7 XL sets a new standard for what you should expect from a full tower case in terms of modularity, flexibility and ease of use. With its dual-layout interior, industrial sound damping and massively versatile layout supporting the largest E-ATX and enterprise boards, multi-GPU setups, outlandish water loops, and almost two dozen storage devices (in Storage layout), you’ll be hard pressed to find a limit to what you can do with your build in the Define 7 XL. New chassis design opens up to fully expose the case interior Anodized aluminum front panel with reversible dual-handed hinges Mount up to 18 HDD/SSDs plus five SSDs in the Storage Layout

Superlative storage Install up to 18 HDDs alongside 5 SSDs mounts in the default Storage Layout. (6 HDD/SSD trays + 2 SSD brackets + 2 multi-brackets included) Type-C interface Five front USB ports including one USB 3.1 Gen 2 Type-C with fast charging and speeds up to 10Gbps Open and interchangeable Remove the entire top to build and route with zero hindrance. Swap in the ventilated panel to add four filtered fan positions.

Generous space An expansive internal layout easily accommodates large motherboards up to E-ATX and SSI-EEB. Elegant new front design Brushed aluminum encases a refined front door design with reversible dual-handed hinges and magnetic latching. Superior airflow Convert to Open Layout and get more than enough room for your custom water loop with large reservoirs and radiators up to 480 mm.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The ONLY case I could find that met my needs....
reviews.reviewText: If you look at one of my attached photos you will see two 16TB standard hard drives; two 8TB standard hard drives; a couple of NVME SSD's (4TB and 2TB); and 12 SSD drives of various sizes. My Garmin watch is attached to transfer my fitness data and it shows up as device D.Anyway, all the hard drives, SSD's and NVME SSD's are tucked away just fine inside this case. I do a lot of photography/video so I have an additional 48TB (six 8TB standard hard drives) tucked away in the upstairs closet.This case is designed to handle numerous drive configuration and does so exceptionally. Still a lot of cables but under the circumstances I think the appearance is great.A VERY HEAVY CASE (Steel Construction) but once in place, who cares?My only negative (a very small one) is there is a POWER L.E.D. on the case, but no HD ACTIVITY L.E.D. Sometimes I want to know if something is going on -- especially if what I am doing appears to be taking much longer then I expected. I will include FRACTAL's reply to this issue, but I just had a real-life experience where knowing there was something going on would have been beneficial.I just downloaded Microsoft Flight Simulator which was released last week. If you have seen articles about the download (once the game was released) many buyers were concerned about the length of time of the download, etc. Often they could not tell if the download was doing anything. I too wondered if the download was working. IT WAS A HUGE DOWNLOAD and install process. It would have been nice if I had a HDD ACTIVITY L.E.D. to let me know something is going on and data is being downloaded and written to my 4TB NVME PCI 4 SSD.Anyway, this is a great case and for the price worth every penny. Quality construction; well designed internal layout; multiple cooling fans; parts and materials packaged well; manual well written; etc.Lastly, here is FRACTAL's reply to my inquiry about the lack of the HDD L.E.D.Hello,The Define 7 XL does not have a Hard Drive activity light. The Define series was originally made to be a media center PC, but the product developers thought it would be annoying to have a light flashing while you are trying to enjoy a movie. It was added to the Define R5 and R6 but we decided to remove it again for the Define 7 cases, as it seems to be waning in popularity these days.So we decided just to have the power LED and if someone wanted to have the HDD LED they could plug the power LED connectors into the HDD LED pins on their motherboard and use their power LED as their HDD LED, because the HDD LED wouldn't flicker if there wasn't any power provided to the system.If you have anymore questions or concerns feel free to ask.Best Regards,ShaneUPDATE 08/2/2021 Since I first built the computer I was referencing in my original post, I have changed the motherboard, et al. I now have 2 Sabrent NVME PCie 4 drives; 3 HDD - Two 16GB drives and Two 8GB drives; and 8 SSD drives from 4TB down to 1TB. None of these changes impacts my opinion of this case - it is fantastic.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very Well Manufactured - Well Designed Case - Got the Quality I paid for
reviews.reviewText: Yes it is expansive inside, but in a well designed way, not just to claim a higher price point by shipping a larger volume of interior airspace. The space is appointed with useful features and extra capabilities. Love the solid quiet build that resulted from my Fractal Design R6 cases and the R7 XL is similar so far. Read good in-depth reviews on other forums, I can only give you modest advice on my own overall purchase philosophy for this product.Always nice these days to purchase some tech gear that you have a reason to keep, reuse, upgrade, not throw or give away. For me this justifies the higher but still fair price of an R7 and the R7 XL. In the future I may replace a video card, or add memory, perhaps even upgrade the motherboard in my system, but the Fractal Design case will see me thru these changes and remain viable for years to come. All the cooling options reinforces it's adaptability. Fractal Design's commitment to quiet computing meets my needs.Thank you Fractal Design engineering and manufacturing teams for producing a great high quality product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The bast case
reviews.reviewText: I choose this case because i build a GENOA server and i can tell you, this case is really great. You can put everything in it. You can move everything piece in the case. it's really a great great case. And i really thank Triplenet Pricing for the product. Everything went well and beyond. Really great service. Thank you again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Built like a tank - amazing flexibility
reviews.reviewText: Wow. I absolutely love this case. It was one of the few large tower cases I could find without a window. I also wanted a lot of front USB ports, and this case delivered. It's built like a bank vault, super quiet, and there are so many options for mounting drives, fans, etc. The instruction manual is incredibly detailed, and it comes with every accessory you'll ever need. All the things you haven't thought about, they have. Really really happy with this case so far!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great case for a quiet build but mine had a rivet defect...
reviews.reviewText: Big, heavy case as expected. Pretty easy to build in. Awkward to move when assembled as others have noted, but I like the flat top (that I can put my external drive doc on, headphones, and other misc. stuff on). The top mounted USB-C is great, along with the 2 USB3 and 2 USB 2 were key features in my decision. I'm using the quiet approach where I have the solid (vs. vented) top. Generally the design is nice - optimized for silence vs. airflow which I understood when I chose it. I have 4 hard drives in the factory default position and quiet fans. Since I'm running NVMe for the OS, most of the time there's not seeking on the hard drives and the thing is near-silent. Seeking/writing operations are noticeable but reasonably muted.Taking off a star due the case having a defect that should have been caught at the factory. It wasn't until I had everything apart that I noticed that one of the case rivets "missed the target" resulting in the misalignment shown in the pictures. I did interact with Fractal on the issue and they were quick and helpful, but basically the only recourse was to return the case. They asked for, and I provided, detail that would indicate which factory they needed to counsel. I decided to drill out the misplaced rivet and stick a small machine screw in the hole to help maintain alignment. Good enough and allowed me to continue the build over the holiday period when I had the time to work on it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sooo Many Options
reviews.reviewText: There is sooo many possibilities with this case. With all the different options for cable management leaves your motherboard looking soo clean. It took me some time to try to figure out how to unscrew certain things to put it in a server setup. Love all the screen filters to reduce the dust. I don't think I will ever go to another case.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Size to add more components
reviews.reviewText: Just great size and fits all components . This is my 2nd purchase.

It's been some time since I purchased a new high quality PC case, and I have to say the Fractal Design Define 7 XL has just been fantastic. From the box opening right though to now building my second unit with the case. Just... Wow. Everything fits perfectly, everything is high quality. Makes me happy just to have an opportunity to use it.I got the XL because I was replacing a old, but good quality Full Tower case, and thought the regular 7 would be mid tower and the XL would be full tower, but the XL is more than full tower, like tower-and-a-half maybe. After installing 2 3090s and a water cooling loop I am very, very happy I have that extra room, but it was more than I thought I needed originally.Can't recommend it enough. Perfect.

reviews.reviewTitle: Build quality and buttons are amazing.
reviews.reviewText: Craftsmanship and build quality is amazing. Really a product that feels high end. Nobody ever talk about the buttons or the door clips in reviews. Let me tell you they are amazing. The switch feels heavy, the case is subtle, understated and very elegant. Doors are solid the final product end up looking and feeling like a solid vault. It's more like a Rolls Royce than a BMW I would say. Very traditional, no RGB, mat black, aluminum in the right places.Only cons: the front door hinges are plastic. It feels cheap and look cheap. If you're interested in opening/closing the front door often to access the CD drives often (why lol?) This case is not for you.Other than that.. the pros list is just too long to list them all. From the perfectly placed and front accessible air filters (the tray is below the door so you dont even need to open the front). The SSDs bay are plentiful, really a storage mammoth for your most evolved builds.After owning Corsair 900D for many years I dont regret the switch. It's still a very high end top of the line product but less Childish RGB everywhere and windows and blablabla. You do have a window option if let's say you're a teenager but for the most part this case do feel more adult and mature.

reviews.reviewTitle: One of the best big cases for a PC
reviews.reviewText: This is my first Fractal Design case, although I have looked at other models in the past. Back then I ended up buying other brands (LianLi) because of the lower price, better availability and same or more features. This time there were so little variants I just had to buy the Define 7 XL. I bought it for my home server because it has lots of interior space, a ridiculous amount of HDD locations and most of all, a very good airflow. My HDDs are now all around 30 degrees Celsius with 21 degrees Celsius ambient temperature (one older HDD is around 35, but it has always been hotter than all the others).I am very, very pleased with how it turned out, but it is a very, very heavy case, even when it is empty. Most things are screwless, like all the panels. The 3 provided 140 mm fans are decent, but I replaced them with Noctua NF-a14 PWM and FLX and it makes the case super silent. I absolutely love the case, but I would have chosen one of the smaller versions for a desktop PC. The Define 7 XL is meant to be used for servers or storage PCs.

Pas beaucoup de poussières à l'intérieur avec les filtres, bien ventilé, on peut mettre beaucoup de disques dur ce qui est très apréciable même si on veut aussi une grosse carte graphique à côté, aucun soucis.Il est aussi silencieux, et c'est vraiment appréciable de pouvoir brancher tous les ventilateurs sur le boitier, puis les alimenter avec l'alimentation directement, puis mettre le pin de tous les ventilateurs sur le pin system de la carte mère qui gére en fonction de la chauffe la puissance des ventilateurs.
No es tan silenciosa como dicen, es una buena caja pero la insonorización ni se nota
